prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. . Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
stories: One night, two young men from Egulac ventured to the river to hunt seals, but as they were there, a fog rolled in and the atmosphere became eerily calm. Suddenly, they heard the sound of war cries and, thinking it was a war party, they hastily escaped to the shore and hid behind a log. As they watched, a canoe carrying five men approached, and the warriors invited them to join the expedition, stating their intent to wage war on the people upstream. One of the young men declined, citing the risk of being killed and his relatives' ignorance of his whereabouts, while the other was persuaded to join the group. However, the reluctant young man later returned home, while the others continued up the river to a town on the opposite side of Kalama, where they engaged in a brutal battle that left many dead. As the warriors retreated, one of them casually mentioned that "that Indian has been hit," a claim that the young man disputed, as he didn't feel sick despite their warnings. Upon returning to Egulac and sharing his tale, the young man fell eerily silent and lethargic, only to eventually succumb to death when a dark object emerged from his mouth, his face contorting into a gruesome grimace. The people present were shocked, and his passing was swift and unexpected.

One evening, two young men from Egulac set out to hunt seals by the river, but as they were there, a thick fog crept in, and the air grew unnervingly still. Suddenly, they heard the sound of war cries, and assuming it was a war party, they quickly fled to the shore and hid behind a log. As they watched, a canoe containing five men approached, and the warriors invited them to join the expedition, explaining their intention to wage war on the people upstream. One of the young men declined, citing the risk of being killed and his relatives' ignorance of his whereabouts, while the other was convinced to join the group. However, the reluctant young man eventually returned to Egulac, while the others continued up the river to a town on the opposite side of Kalama, where they engaged in a brutal battle that left many dead. As the warriors retreated, one of them nonchalantly mentioned that "that Indian has been hit," a claim that the young man disputed, as he didn't feel ill despite their warnings. Upon returning to Egulac and sharing his tale, the young man suddenly fell eerily silent and lethargic, only eventually succumbing to death when a dark object emerged from his mouth, his face contorting into a gruesome grimace. The people present were stunned, and his passing was swift and unexpected.

One evening, two young friends from Egulac started a seal-hunting expedition along the river, but the dense fog that rolled in soon made them uneasy. When they arrived at the site, a sudden outburst of conflict startled them, and they hid behind a log to observe the chaos. A canoe carrying five warriors approached, and they were invited to join the expedition, revealing a plan to launch a surprise attack on an upstream population. One of the friends refused, fearing danger and uncertainty for his family, while the other agreed to join. The hesitant friend later returned to Egulvac, while the others continued upstream to a town on the opposite side of Kalama, where they got entangled in a brutal battle and suffered numerous casualties. As the warriors retreated, one of them casually mentioned, "that Indian has been hit," but the young man disputed this, convinced he was unscathed. One afternoon, two friends from a village set out to hunt seals along the river, but the thick fog that rolled in soon became unsettling. When they arrived at the hunting site, a sudden commotion surprised them, and they hid behind a log to watch the chaos unfold. A canoe carrying five warriors appeared, and they were asked to join the expedition, revealing a plan to launch a surprise attack on a nearby settlement. One of the friends declined, fearing danger and uncertainty for his loved ones, while the other agreed to participate. The hesitant friend later returned to his village, while the others continued upstream to a fort on the opposite shore, where they became embroiled in a brutal battle and suffered significant losses. As the warriors retreated, one of them nonchalantly remarked, "That warrior has been injured," but the young man disagreed, convinced he was unharmed. Upon returning to his village, the young man suddenly became withdrawn and lethargic, and eventually died from a mysterious illness, his face contorting in a gruesome grimace. Those present were left stunned, and his passing was swift and unexpected.
